template.p: You just installed the Odoo for Climbing Gym package. By doing so, we have installed a bunch of necessary apps to run your business efficiently.
Discover the basics of this package and explore all the possibilities Odoo offers to improve your experience.

div.p: If you want to execute a practical guided tour of this module, you should Import demo data and try the Demo - Use Case (In the next Knowledge Article)

hr.p: You can access every installed App in your Odoo database on your main dashboard.

ul.li: Sell subscriptions product from the Subscription App and the Sales App
Manage your employees' shifts with the Planning App
Sell goods on the fly from the Point of Sale App
Resupply when needed with Purchase App
Record entrances through the Contact App based on subscription or prepaid cards
Manage waiver with the Sign App
Generate visibility through the Website App
Promote your upcoming events with the Events App

hr.p: By uploading this module's demo data, your database has been filled with a few products, sale orders and more.
You should be able to execute the following flows to have an overview of various flows you can quickly execute with this package using Odoo.
Of course, this is just an overview of the features included in this package. Feel free to add new apps, delete/modify demo data, and test everything around!

div.p: You didn't import demo data? You can still do it. Go to Apps > Industries > Upgrade your Bar & Pub package and check the related box

hr.p: To manage waivers, we take advantage of the Sign App from the customer form.

ul.li: Open the Contact App and create a new customer record filling in especially the email address.
Save your new contact to reveal the Send Waiver button.
Hit the Sent Waiver button to request the signature.

div.class: o_editor_banner user-select-none o-contenteditable-false lh-1 d-flex align-items-center alert alert-success pb-0 pt-3
o_editor_banner_content o-contenteditable-true w-100 px-3
div.p:
You can define your own waiver form from the Sign App, within the templates.
Make sure only one template with "Is Waiver" field is set (visible in the list view).

ul.li: Find out signed documents from the smart button at the top of the contact form labelled Signature Requested.

hr.p: Two types of product can be sold to access the climbing area:

ul.li: Single entrances which as well can be sold in bundles.
Subscriptions for unlimited access during a period of time.
Open the Sales App and create a new order.
Select your freshly created customer.
Add a bundle of 10 entrances.

div.class: o_editor_banner user-select-none o-contenteditable-false lh-1 d-flex align-items-center alert alert-info pb-0 pt-3
o_editor_banner_content o-contenteditable-true w-100 px-3
div.p: Single entrances are to be used live while bundles consist in a loyalty card from which can be used entrances later on.

ul.li: Confirm the order and bill your customer.

template.p:
Your customer now has a loyalty card for the corresponding sessions.
You can reach the loyalty cards and appreciate their balances from the smart button for Loyalty Cards in the Contact form.

ul.li: Open the Sales App or alternatively the Subscription App and create a new order.
Select again your freshly created customer.
Add a subscription to the quote and select the plan for this customer.
Confirm the order and bill your customer.

template.p:
As a result, your customer now is member of the corresponding level.
Open the contact form to appreciate the change.
This gives access to entrances as well as discounts at the point of sales.

div.class: o_editor_banner user-select-none o-contenteditable-false lh-1 d-flex align-items-center alert alert-success pb-0 pt-3
o_editor_banner_content o-contenteditable-true w-100 px-3
div.p: Be creative on advantages associated to your subscriptions: discount at the point of sale on good, discount if you hold a bar, dicounts on events...

ul.li:
You can directly create invoices from a confirmed sales order from the Sales App.
In this case, you would handle the payment on the side as you please.
Alternatively, you can pull a sale order from a register of the Point of Sales App.
Open the three dots menu from the register in the bottom left corner.
Click the Quotation / Order option and select the sale order to pull.
Proceed to payment!

template.p: Next time you new customer comes at the desk to use an entrance, whether from the subscription or the loyalty card, you will consume an entrance.

ul.li: Open your customer contact form from the Contact App.
When a contact has an ongoing subscription or a positive balance or entrance on a loyalty card, the Use Session button is available above the form.
Hit the Use Session. This creates a new quote to consume a session, which is paid with a discount in case of a subscription and with a loyalty session in the case of session bundles.
Confirm the order to record the entrance!

template.p: Of course, for single entrances, it is straight forward.

div.class: o_editor_banner user-select-none o-contenteditable-false lh-1 d-flex align-items-center alert alert-success pb-0 pt-3
o_editor_banner_content o-contenteditable-true w-100 px-3
div.p: Monitoring consumed entrances might be a good idea to capture rush hours...

hr.p: To handle the front desk, to provide lessons and more, employees are needed. And to organize all this, Planning App is the place to be.

ul.li: Open the Planning App and navigate to next week.
See that shifts are already planned and unassigned.

Hit the Auto Plan button beside the Publish one.
This assign the shifts to employees based on their roles.

div.class: o_editor_banner user-select-none o-contenteditable-false lh-1 d-flex align-items-center alert alert-info pb-0 pt-3
o_editor_banner_content o-contenteditable-true w-100 px-3
div.p: Edit their roles from the Employee form, in the Employees App, at the bottom of the Work Information tab.

ul.li: Changes shift assignations as you please.
Publish the planning to communicate to your employees when they are expected.
Navigate to the next week where no shifts are planned so far.
Hit a Planning cell to plan a shift.

div.class: o_editor_banner user-select-none o-contenteditable-false lh-1 d-flex align-items-center alert alert-info pb-0 pt-3
o_editor_banner_content o-contenteditable-true w-100 px-3
div.p:
Leverage the shift templates for recurrent shifts by roles.
You can edit those from the Configuration menu.

ul.li: Alternatively to this tedious work of single shift creation, replicate you previous week planning by clicking the Copy previous week button beside the Publish button.

hr.p: You as well have goods to sell because some climbers may forget their chalk or hurt their fingers... Let's see how the Point of Sale App can help you quickly sell such products.

ul.li: Open the Point of Sales App and open the register.
Set your opening balance and you're ready to efficient sales.
Create a new order and select goods such as chalk and tape.
Proceed to payment and they are good to go!

div.class: o_editor_banner user-select-none o-contenteditable-false lh-1 d-flex align-items-center alert alert-info pb-0 pt-3
o_editor_banner_content o-contenteditable-true w-100 px-3
div.p: In this configuration, products are not tracked in terms of count but feel free to explore Inventory App to setup the appropriate products and benefit from capabilities which meet your needs.

hr.p: To make some noise and generate a feeling of community among your customer, you most likely are organizing events. The Events App got your back for this.

ul.li: Open the Events App and create a new event.
Give it a name, adjust its dates, and then save it.
Click the Go to Website smart button at the top of the screen.
Hit the Unpublished toggle in order to publish it to your website visitors.
Obviously, feel free to update its page by entering the website editor mode from the top right corner.

div.p: Selling event registration from your website is as well possible and requires to activate a payment provider.
